Ich mÃ¶chte etwas verspÃ¤tet Cyberpunk 2077 bewerten, dabei werde ich die neuesten Ã„nderungen, die mit dem DLC verÃ¶ffentlicht wurden, auÃŸer Acht lassen, da ich weder den DLC noch das Spiel seit seinem groÃŸen Update ausreichend gespielt habe.

Also kann ich Cyberpunk 2077 guten Gewissens empfehlen? Die Antwort lautet tatsÃ¤chlich: Ja. 
Ich habe bereits zum Release mit dem Spiel begonnen und ja, ich muss in dieser Bewertung auch die "katastrophale Release-Version" zumindest erwÃ¤hnen. Allerdings gehÃ¶rte ich wohl zu den wenigen, die kaum etwas von den zahlreichen Bugs bemerkt haben. Gelegentlich lief mal ein Charakter durch eine Wand und Autos bewegten sich hin und wieder seltsam buggy durch die Spielwelt, aber nichts war Gamebreaking und abgesehen davon blieb ich mit Bugs verschont.

Aber Cyberpunk hat auch abseits der Bugs ein paar "Schwierigkeiten", denn obwohl das Spiel viele Facetten bietet und die Entscheidungsfreiheit riesig ist, hat es eine Weile gedauert, bis alles bei mir ankam. Das liegt nicht nur an dem durchschnittlichen Kampfsystem, welches nicht schlecht, aber eben auch nicht â€besondersâ€œ ist, sondern auch an den freischaltbaren FÃ¤higkeiten, die lange Zeit hinter Level Anforderungen verborgen sind.
Es gab viele Momente, in denen ich mich gefragt habe: Warum ist das so? Oder wie viel Arbeit muss ich denn jetzt bitte fÃ¼r diese Kleinigkeit hier reinstecken? Nichts davon war sehr frustrierend, aber eben etwas lÃ¤stig.  

Vielmehr liegt die StÃ¤rke aber in der Welt und der Story, denn die erzÃ¤hlten Geschichten, die faszinierenden Charaktere und die dÃ¼stere AtmosphÃ¤re bleiben mir bis heute in Erinnerung. Night City ist fÃ¼r mich eine der authentischsten Spielwelten, die ich je erleben durfte und da fragt man sich schon wie authentisch in Zukunft irgendwann ein GTA 6 sein wird.
AuÃŸerdem besonders hervorstechend sind der Soundtrack und die Synchronisation, welche absolute Weltklasse sind.

Ich bin von Cyberpunk 2077 eigentlich absolut begeistert und es freut mich, dass durch die vielen Updates immer mehr Spieler in den Genuss des Spiels kommen. Irgendwann werde ich mir nochmal die Zeit nehmen und auch das â€neueâ€œ Cyberpunk erleben. 
Stand jetzt, bin ich bereits sehr zufrieden und von mir  gibtâ€™s eine Kaufempfehlung!

163846268.review:
Cyberpunk 2077 is not just a game. This is a journey into a world where the future has become a dark shadow of its promises. Here luxury is side by side with poverty, and behind the splendor of the metropolis lies rot and lawlessness.
Imagine:

- Night streets flooded with neon light reflected in the cybernetic eyes of passers-by.
- The roar of engines echoing through the gorges of skyscrapers.
- The smell of gunpowder in the air after a shootout.

In this world:

- Technology has intertwined with flesh, turning people into cyborgs.
- Corporations rule the ball, and the law is just an empty phrase.
- Gangs are prowling the streets, ready to do anything for profit.

You're Vi:

- A lone wolf, surviving in this crazy metropolis.
- A mercenary who is ready to take on any job if the price is to your liking.
- A death machine capable of incinerating enemies with a hail of bullets.

Your story:

- The path to fame or obscurity is up to you.
- Choice by choice, you will change not only your destiny, but also the world around you.
- Meetings with charismatic characters â€“ from gangsters

163822343.review:
Cyberpunk's launch will go down as one of the worst AAA launches. However, the game will also go down as one of the best RPGs ever made. 

While the game was already amazing in terms of its storytelling - atmosphere, lore, tone, music and narrative; it took CDPR more than three years to iron out the bugs and overhaul the gameplay. But it's here even if it's late. The 2.0 update is what the game should've been from the beginning.

Following The Witcher 3's structure, the game is written with so much detail that you can't tell the main or side quests apart in terms of quality. CDPR manages to convey a variety of intense themes in this neo-noir retrofuturistic dystopia. There are no happy stories in Night City, only bittersweet ones with a hint of despair. 

V is one of the best protagonists in an RPG - well written for every choice, and having a personality - not just a blank slate. And Phantom Liberty is probably the best espionage thriller in this medium. 

Incredibly gripping tale of survival, combat and gameplay that let you experiment with your choices, and an unparalleled level of visuals and immersion.

161938289.review:
Wow.... what a journey.

I... I dont know what to say, 111 hours, the characters, the music the... wow just wow.

Few games make me feel like this game made me feel, i can count them on 1 hand.

I'm in post-shock, you just forget sometimes that good stories can be done.

Enjoyment score for this one is the rare 100%
Despite higher difficulties (very hard) making enemies a bit bullet spongy, just drop that to normal or hard and this game is a masterwork to behold.

The credits probably rolled for an hour

should probably pick my jaw up from the floor.

Â¿Por quÃ© comprar Cyberpunk 2077 en 2024?
Yo lo comprÃ© anticipadamente en 2020 por el hype que provocÃ³ en ese entonces.
Â¿QuÃ© pude aprender en ese momento? que nunca volverÃ­a a comprar algo sin ver el rendimiento antes.
Â¿QuÃ© puedo decir ahora despuÃ©s de darle otra oportunidad 4 aÃ±os despuÃ©s? Un DULCE AMARGO.
- Este juego me despertÃ³ algo que muy pocos lo han hecho: muchas emociones y reflexiÃ³n en cada minuto de juego. Su historia es muy atrapante y que te lleva a no saltarte ningÃºn diÃ¡logo.
-En jugabilidad cambiÃ³ bastante con la actu 2.0 y puedo decir que fue un acierto total. El combate cuerpo a cuerpo es muy entretenido y hay gran variedad de armas tanto mele como de fuego.
-GrÃ¡ficamente es muy bonito. Night City es hermosa tanto de noche como de dÃ­a. Las partes del desierto se ven muy bien a mi parecer.
Pero como todo videojuego no es perfecto y tiene algunas cositas que a veces se notan, pero que no afectan el rumbo de la historia o jugabilidad, como un bug de vez en cuando o la inteligencia de los npc no son la gran cosa.

En fin, si lo ves en descuento, comprarlo, ya que vale mucho la pena

El juego a evolucionado bastante bien a pesar de tener un lanzamiento horrendo, hoy en dia el videojuego es una verdadera experiencia sin perdida, tal vez algun bug gracioso pero que no influya en tu experiencia.
Visualmente este juego es hermoso, los enemigos estan bien en dificultad e inteligencia, la historia se desarrolla bastante bien y es interesante como la cuentan.
Compralo, no lo dudes

162200174.review:
[h1] V, Il Mercenario Che Voleva Diventare Una Leggenda! [/h1] 

E se puÃ² sembrarvi troppo riduttiva, come Sintesi, sappiate che la sostanza di Cyberpunk 2077 potrebbe star in questa frase...se poi non si infilasse qualcun altro a complicarci decisamente la vita.
C2077 Ã¨ la Storia di un Mercenario, o Mercenaria che vogliate ( visto che il personaggio Ã¨ totalmente personalizzabile, tranne per il fatto che si ChiamerÃ  V e ha un suo proprio carattere e dei Sogni ), che partendo dai bassifondi ( con un origine a vostra scelta, che varierÃ  alcune opzioni di dialogo ), si inserisce nella Fluorescente e Tentacolare Night City, per tentare di diventare una leggenda, in questa cittÃ  che altrimenti tutto fagocita, tra Corporazioni, tecnologia, innesti cibernetici, Bande di strada e Fixer dalle richieste svariate, avrete la vostra Piccola Modena Epopea Cibernetica.
Quest' aVventura di ampio respiro, Ã¨ confezionata in Prima Persona, nell' abito di un Immersive Sim GDR Action Open City ( appunto, Night City e periferia ).
E Impersonando V, avrete a disposizione tutto quello che un gioco di questo tipo offre: Vasto parco Veicoli per solcare la CittÃ , Ampio parco d' armi dalle bianche fin alle migliori Mitragliette Smart, ampie possibilitÃ  di potenziare il vostro corpo con tantissimi innesti cybernetici di svariate tipologie, la possibilitÃ  di salire di livello per sbloccare AbilitÃ  e Talenti per personalizzare il vostro modo di giocare, e abbastanza varietÃ  d' approccio ad ogni situazione ( seppur spesso l' approccio furtivo Ã¨ maggiormente premiato ).
Che Gran Belle Premesse, Vero?

 [h2] Cosa ho Adorato di C2077 [/h2] 

<(^_^)> Night City Ã¨ maestosa, Ammaliante con le sue luci al Neon, Stordente con la sua mole continua di PubblicitÃ  che la invadono in ogni angolo, Stupenda di Notte e malinconia quando bagnata dalla pioggia.
Va detto che Ã¨ una dei protagonisti principali di questo titolo, ed Ã¨ un opera d' Architettura E Urbanistica Videoludica veramente ben riuscita, inoltre Ã¨ stata una vera goduria da attraversare a bordo di un Veicolo.

<(^_^)>La lore del mondo di gioco Ã¨ veramente ben curata ( grazie all' ottima base tratta dal Gioco di ruolo che offre l' ambientazione al gioco ), come son ben curate le Corporazioni che la popolano, le Varie Bande di Strada ( variopinte e molto diverse ), le pubblicitÃ  che vi martelleranno senza sosta, il design di veicoli, persone, edifici  ben coerenti con il tutto, fornendoci un bellissimo e profondo background in cui muoverci.

<(^_^)>Inutile dire che sul piano Grafico, e Sonoro, il gioco Ã¨ una vera goduria, e ci regala una stupenda ambientazione da gustarsi con gli occhi, e con le orecchie grazie ad una bella colonna sonora condita di tantissimi brani che vale la pena continuar ad ascoltare anche all' infuori dell' esperienza di gioco

<(^_^)> I Personaggi principali, tra cui il Ribelle Jhonny Silverhand, come pure gli altri comprimari, son veramente ben curati, con straordinarie animazioni facciali che li rendon ancora piÃ¹ Reali, un ottimo background e uno stupendo doppiaggio.
E attenzione, la storia principale non Ã¨ da meno, con riflessioni, un ottimo ritmo e colpi di scena, dilemmi morali e delle decisioni non facili,  che dovremo prendere, per decidere il corso degli eventi...decisamente una signora TRama principale.

<(^_^)> Sul lato Gameplay, devo dire che le grandi possibilitÃ  di personalizzazione del nostro personaggio e delle sue abilitÃ , permettono di creare veramente molte  build diverse, che regalano feeling, approcci e modalitÃ  di gioco molto diverse, regalando quindi una buona rigiocabilitÃ  e libertÃ  d' approccio ad ogni scontro e situazione, di modo da far contenti tutti: dal purista del corpo a corpo devastante, all' amante dell' assassionio silenzioso, per finire all' esperto di hacking e armi a colpi ricercanti :)

 [h2] Tuttavia, Questa Maestosa Opera non mi ha convinto in alcuni punti.. [/h2] 

(â—¡ï¸µâ—¡) C2077, dopo la 2.0 ( e sopratutto la sua magnifica Espansione ), Ã¨ finalmente un gioco d' alta qualitÃ  con buona parte delle promesse mantenute, tuttavia noi videogiocatori non dobbiamo mai dimenticare la grandiosa presa per il fondoschiena che Cdprojekt ha fatto a tantissimi nel suo momento del lancio, mandando sul mercato un titolo Buggatissimo, incompleto su molte meccaniche, ingiocabile su PS4, che ha rischiesto almeno 3 anni di patch pesantissime per poter finalmente diventare il Cigno promesso...una vergogna che mai dovrebbe esser dimenticata.

(â—¡ï¸µâ—¡)Certo, ho elogiato Night City per la sua meravigliosa costruzione, tuttavia va anche detto che son rimasto un pÃ² deluso dal constatare che esplorarla Ã¨ un esperienza che ho trovato un pÃ² povera.
Dato che, seppur magnifica a colpo d' occhio, appena scendiamo nei suoi vicoli, si nota come le vie di un quartiere sian tutte simili senza nessuna particolaritÃ , senza nessuna interazione interessante con lei ed i suoi abitanti, e tolto qualche ester eggs nascosto quÃ  e lÃ , e gli eventi casuali della NCPd ( alla lunga stancanti ), la cittÃ  Ã¨ una stupenda Cartolina ottima come sfondo, ma poco gustosa come particolari, e senza molto da scoprire o fare al di fuori delle varie quest.

(â—¡ï¸µâ—¡)Seppur la Trama principale sia stupenda, e pure alcune quest secondarie son veramente ben fatte, devo ammettere con amarezza che la maggior parte dei ( e alla lunga monotoni ) contratti dei Fixer, e tante missioni secondarie ( per non parlare di quegli eventi segnati da un punto esclamativo che sarebbero stati piÃ¹ interessanti se resi casuali o da scoprire, anzichÃ¨ segnalati..eddai ), son abbastanza piatti, a volte ripetitivi e privi di approfondimento nei dialoghi, nelle possibilitÃ  e nello svolgersi della trama...molti sembrano fatti di fretta piÃ¹ per riempirtivo che per dar qualitÃ .

(â—¡ï¸µâ—¡)La difficoltÃ  del gioco Ã¨ troppo tarata verso il basso, offrendo anche a livello difficile un esperienza troppo facile a mio parere, con una facilitÃ  incredibile nel reperire soldi ( giÃ  a metÃ  gioco ero ricchissimo ),e qualche sfida solo verso taluni boss, o miniboss, particolarmente abili nel corpo a corpo se non avrete una build adeguata ( anche qui, a mio parere, un errore di bilanciamento delle possibilitÃ  che il gioco offre )...questa cosa di rendere un esperienza videoludica troppo facile alla lunga finisce per stancare molti che cercano un minimo di sfida...

(â—¡ï¸µâ—¡)Le grandi premesse riguardo le Scelte nel gioco, alla fine le ho trovato deludenti, con poche situazioni in cui veramente possiamo compiere delle scelte decisive ai fini della trama, e sopratutto, quando ciÃ² accadde Ã¨ troppo guidato e scontato capire cosa accadrÃ . Senza contante che in tante situazioni mi pare manchino maggiori opzioni di dialogo che avrebbero potuto portare a una maggior scelta del destino di V ( alla fine molto guidato ), a volte vien a mancare anche un pÃ² di chiarezza su cosa veramente andrÃ  a rispondere V se sceglieremo una linea di dialogo anzichÃ¨ un' altra, e in tantissime trame secondarie le possiblitÃ  di scelta son veramente ridicole se non inesistenti...peccato
Si percepisce che C2077 Ã¨ un opera stupenda, ma creata di fretta, in modo sperimentale, e che si sarebbe potuto far molto di piÃ¹, come ha dimostrato la stupenda Espanzione "Phantom Liberty", che risulta molto piÃ¹ riuscita, raffinata e curata, in tutti quegli aspetti che il gioco principale pecca, confermando la mia teoria.

[h1]Grafik:[/h1] Die visuelle Pracht von Cyberpunk 2077 ist auch Jahre nach dem Release noch beeindruckend. Vor allem mit aktiviertem Ray Tracing erwacht Night City zum Leben, mit seinen neonbeleuchteten StraÃŸen und den glitzernden Wolkenkratzern, die den Himmel durchdringen. Jedes Detail wurde liebevoll gestaltet, von den Gesichtern der Charaktere bis hin zu den kleinsten StraÃŸenecken, und verleiht der Welt eine unglaubliche Tiefe. Dass das Spiel auch noch rein aus der Ego-Perspektive spielt, macht das ganze noch immersiver und lÃ¤sst einen deutlich mehr in die Welt eintauchen, als wenn es eine Third-Person Ansicht gebe.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1] Das Gameplay aus Cyberpunk 2077 vereint Action, Stealth und Rollenspielelemente, gepaart mit Shooter-Gameplay. Ob du dich fÃ¼r direkte Konfrontationen entscheidest oder lieber auf Tarnung und Taktik setzt, bleibt ganz dir Ã¼berlassen. Durch das Anpassen deiner FÃ¤higkeiten und AusrÃ¼stung, kannst du deine Spielweise optimieren, und vom schwer gepanzerten Solo - der direkt durch die VordertÃ¼re prescht - bis hin zum schleichenden Hacker der ein Katana im Kampf nutzt, als genau der Spielen der du sein mÃ¶chtest. Zahlreiche Enden und unterschiedliche "Builds" erhÃ¶hen den Wiederspielwert dadurch enorm. 

[h1]Sprachausgabe:[/h1] Ich habe das ganze Spiel auf deutsch gespielt, und die Sprachausgabe von Cyberpunk 2077 ist einfach herausragend. Jede Stimme ist perfekt besetzt und verleiht den Charakteren eine unglaubliche AuthentizitÃ¤t und Tiefe. FÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich besonders beeindruckend war die Leistung von Keanu Reeves als Johnny Silverhand, und Benjamin VÃ¶lz der ihm in der deutschen Fassung seine Stimme lieh, doch auch BjÃ¶rn Schalla als mÃ¤nnlicher "V" war ebenfalls eine top Besetzung.

[h1]Fazit:[/h1] Ich habe das Spiel das erste mal am 10. Dezember 2020, um 7 Uhr morgens gestartet. Und heute - nach mehr als drei Jahren und unzÃ¤hligen Stunden in Night City kann ich mit Sicherheit sagen, dass Cyberpunk 2077 eines der besten Spiele ist, die ich persÃ¶nlich je gespielt habe. 163156496.review:
I don't think i've ever had as much fun with an RPG as I ever have with 2077. This is the first game in a while where I got deep into the lore and found myself making a new character every time I return. It's crazy that its STILL getting updates and making the game ever better to the point where playing a build I used to is now entirely new and more fun. It's insane what an extra 4 years of development did for this game to where i'd say it's now in my top games of all time. 

Edgerunners made me give it a chance when I was on the fence, and every piece of awesome content that came after kept me around. I'm looking forward to more games with the Cyberpunk license in the future (and hopefully with actual development time)

163495174.review:
Cyberpunk 2077 a game with over 7 years of development even though didn't perform good at its initial launch but after several patches now the game is every gamer's dream as it provides a new way of combat and environment. Set in future the main story line shows how a nomad(as I chose this route) with a dream to get rich and live his dreams enter Night city and how his situation fluctuates as we proceed further in the story with a new companion Johnny silver and his quests. This game provides the player with a lot of freedom to buy ow apartments , cars and beat the crap out of the bandits in your own way. Still having few bugs the game is a must try out and highly recommended.

Talking about the dlc where V gets his a second chance of getting cured but by playing the dlc you get to know how hard the decision gets as you reach the finale of this dlc. This dlc provides a even better performance then the main game and is also highly recommended.

Just remember: Night City Changes Everybody.

162250317.review:
I love Cyberpunk with every fiber of my being.

I played this game from Day 1, and my first play-through was nothing but a perfect experience. I never ran into a single bug (that was noticeable anyways), fell in love with all of the characters, and got lost in the world of Night City and the Badlands. I laughed, cried, stressed, and had an amazing time all around with every aspect of this game. The 2.0 and 2.1 updates made this game absolutely perfect in every way possible as well. It also helps that there is an amazingly made show in Cyberpunk: Edgerunners to compliment this game.

[h2] STORY [/h2]
The story in this game is the closest thing to perfection that I [b] [i] *personally* [/i] [/b] have ever experienced. Sure, the beginning of the game can feel slow and sluggish on repeat play-throughs, but on that first initial one, it felt perfect. I hated Johnny in the beginning, but by the end of the game, he was a definite bro. Anyone familiar with the general Cyberpunk setting knows what they're getting into with this story. A cover of shiny, bright neon lights that is hiding a dark dystopian underbelly where most of the population suffers while the top 1% thrives on the top, not letting anyone rise up to their level without plenty of trouble. This is one of those stories, where I wish I could lose my memory of ever touching this game, and replay it all again for the first time. Especially with Phantom Liberty being out, and that having a fantastic story to go along with it.

That being said, there are obviously some side missions that feel like they could've been left out, or are just flat out boring. There are even a couple main missions that feel like obvious filler, but that's to be expected. I also wish the Life Path you can choose at the beginning of the game mattered more, however I'm not a writer or game dev, so I don't know how they would've been able to work that in, at least in a meaningful way. 

[h2] GAMEPLAY & COMBAT [/h2] 
It's a first person shooter. In all reality, that's what it boils down to. The gun-play feels great, with some of the bigger guns making them feel as powerful as they look. The Cyberware makes for great combat modifiers, especially if you have a Sandevistan, Mantis Blades, or the ever popular Monowire.  However, with the 2.0 update, they overhauled how Cyberware works, with it acting as your armor rating now. They also made it so that V can go cyber-psycho, however obviously not to the extent that the citizens of Night City can as it's shown in plenty of encounters. 

The driving feels great for what it is. My only gripe with it is the handling of motorcycles, however, I'm fully willing to admit I could just suck with those.

[h2] WORLD [/h2]
The world that Cyberpunk inhabits is absolutely stunning. Driving into Night City from the Badlands in the middle of the night, with "I Really Want to Stay at Your House" or "Night City" playing on Body Heat Radio is just an entirely different feeling. Driving through the neon filled streets of Night City while it's raining adds to the ambiance even more. Speaking of music...

The music that CDPR had crafted for this world couldn't be any better. Whether it's the many bangers on Body Heat Radio, any of the Samurai songs, or the myriad of original songs on any of the other stations, everything feels like it belongs. Major Crimes. I Really Want to Stay at Your House (for obvious reasons), Delicate Weapon (which they made an ENTIRE PERFORMANCE FOR in Phantom Liberty), and Never Fade Away are the absolute bangers. The song they made for the credit sequence for Phantom Liberty is also top tier, along with the version of Never Fade Away they use for the credit sequence for the main game. There's a song for everyone in this game, and who knows, you might end up discovering you like a different genre of music that you didn't expect. 

[h1] FINAL VERDICT [/h1]
If you haven't played this game yet, do yourself a favor and set time aside to just lose yourself in the world and it's story. No talking to friends on Discord, no listening to music or any kind of video on YouTube, nothing. Just immerse yourself and lose yourself in this masterpiece of a game. Don't listen to what people say about this game being awful, buggy or broken. They are stuck in the past of when this game first released, which yes, was in a very rough state for a lot of people. But now with the 2.0 and 2.1 updates out, and one more planned update, this is the absolute perfect time to get into this game. Don't worry about Male or Female V, don't worry about what life path you want, you do you.

Phantom Liberty isn't a giant requirement either, however, it is a fantastic story. Idris Elba and Minji Chang do a phenomenal job as Reed and Songbird respectively. Along with Keanu Reeves coming back to play Johnny Silverhand once again for the expansion, it really is just the complete package, and [b] [i] *in my opinion,* [/i] [/b] a [b] must play [/b] for the game as a whole. 

And once you finish the game, don't skip the credits. This goes for Phantom Liberty as well when that credit scene ends. No matter what endings you get (because there are multiple for both the base game and Phantom Liberty), the credits are amazing to just sit through and listen to and experience. 

Give it a try, chooms. You won't regret it.

I really (I mean REALLY) want to gives this game a 100 buts there are still some bugs/crashes that leave a bad taste.  But im also happy that the developers did their best to fix most of the bugs to make this game playable for most of us. WIthout it it would have been a dead game in my eye. Overall time/price comparison is good and I did enjoy it. As in replayability, once you finish the game all the things left are just repetitive.
